result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. STEVEN J LEE

records.addlTxt:
11:21 AM Defendant STEVEN J LEE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for STEVEN J LEE.  Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint. Defendant is informed of charges and penalties. Attorney Harless has received copy of Criminal Complaint. 
Defendant requests time to obtain county appointed attorney or private counsel. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
(Jail/5053)

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions. 
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia/ syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume illegal drugs/ any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant STEVEN J LEE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless appeared by video for STEVEN J LEE.  Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.
